com.hv15.aperi

Class AperiMainActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • com.hv15.aperi.AperiMainActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionBar.TabListener, ComponentCallbacks, ComponentCallbacks2, WifiP2pManager.ChannelListener, KeyEvent.Callback, LayoutInflater.Factory, LayoutInflater.Factory2, View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, Window.Callback, DeviceActionListener, MacIpListener

    public class AperiMainActivity
extends Activity
implements WifiP2pManager.ChannelListener, DeviceActionListener, ActionBar.TabListener, MacIpListener
    An activity that uses android.net.wifi.p2p API to discover and connect with available devices. WifiP2p APIs are asynchronous and rely on callback mechanism using interfaces to notify the application of operation success or failure. The application makes use of a BroadcastReceiver for notification of Wi-Fi state related events.

    Furthermore the application makes use of the Android Support Library, allowing for the use of the TabsPagerAdaptor to provide a swiping UI effect.

    Version:
    1 (prototype 3798)
    Author:
    Hans-Nikolai Viessmann

      • register

        protected void register()
        Callback to register the AperiBroadcastReceiver to the Activity

        This is a bit of a hack. As far as I can tell there is much of a problem with doing something like this, just that it might be more convenient to associate the AperiBroadcastReceiver with the SelfFragment considering that it is the default starting point for the user. Also it might be an idea to think about using a background Service instead of a BroadcastReciever so that this application could then function (partially) in the background as well.

      • getDeviceStatus

        protected static String getDeviceStatus(int deviceStatus)
        Get a human understandable status message
        Parameters:
        deviceStatus - as specified by WifiP2pDevice
        Returns:
        String with human-readable status
        See Also:
        WifiP2pDevice

      • clearPeers

        protected void clearPeers()
        Remove all peers.

        This is called on AperiBroadcastReceiver receiving at state change event of WIFI_P2P_STATE_CHANGED_ACTION.

        See Also:
        DeviceListFragment.clearPeers()
